text: hi everyone is Helen here today I will
be making Vietnamese pickle bean sprouts
you yeah
it's super light and colorful and you
can eat it with any other meat or fish
dishes at the salad and it's vegetarian
so I hope you like it and let's begin
you will need one bunch of garlic chives
cut into two and a half inch lamb for a
pop-up red color we're going to use two
red pepperonis you can also use red bell
pepper just remove the core and slide
into thin strips like adults into thin
slices using diagonal cuts then stack
them on each other and slide into thin
strips
you also need one thumb size piece of
ginger peel and also slide into
matchsticks strips of course you need
bean sprouts which I have rings a few
times and gray remove some of the roots
if you want then mixing all the
julienned vegetables together carrots
garlic chives red peppers and ginger
what a colorful mix of vegetables
give it a good toss or gentle mix to
make the brine you will need 1 cup of
water mix with 1 cup of white vinegar
also add in half a cup of sugar and half
a teaspoon of salt stir really well
until completely dissolved then pour the
mixture all over the vegetables and
gently mix it up with your hands the
vegetables are still very bulky and easy
to break at this stage just set aside
for one to two hours and you will see
that they will flow and shrink in volume
like this now they become flexible and
bendable now transfer them to a glass
jar or a plastic container don't forget
to pour in the vinegar brine and make
sure that it covers the vegetables
completely it's ready to eat in four
hours and lasts for a couple of weeks
this sweet and sour pickles go perfect
with any meat or fish dishes it's very
refreshing and appetizing for spring and
summer today I have it for dinner
together with a plate of boy pot belly
some baby eggplant in shrimp sauce and
kimchi soup everyone in the family will
have the old ball of hot steamed rice
and we going to share all these side
dishes together
it's a typical Vietnamese meal with rice
one meat dish one vegetable dish and a
soup that's it I hope you and your
family will like it
thank you for watching my
you
